llm_response.description: The retinal fundus image shows multiple intraretinal hemorrhages scattered throughout the retina. There are no signs of neovascularization or vitreous hemorrhage. No significant venous beading or intraretinal microvascular abnormalities (IRMA) are observed.

The retinal fundus image shows a clear view of the optic disc and macula. There are no visible microaneurysms, hemorrhages, exudates, cotton wool spots, venous beading, intraretinal microvascular abnormalities (IRMA), or neovascularization. The retinal vessels appear normal without any signs of diabetic retinopathy.

The retinal fundus image shows a few microaneurysms and small hemorrhages. There are no signs of neovascularization, vitreous or preretinal hemorrhage. No venous beading or intraretinal microvascular abnormalities (IRMA) are observed. There are also a few hard exudates present.
